title: First Lady of China donates anti-epidemic supplies to First Lady of Malawi
description: On July 28, 2020, a ceremony was held at the Kamuzu Presidential Palace for the donation of anti-epidemic materials to Malawi's First Lady, Monica Chakwera, on the behalf of China’s First Lady Peng Liyuan.  Chinese Ambassador to Malawi, Liu Hongyang, the First Lady of Malawi, and Malawi’s Minister of Health attended the ceremony and delivered speeches. The supplies, which included thermometers and face masks, are intended to help mothers, youths, and health workers.  The donation was made at the behest of the Organization of African First Ladies for Development and was part of a larger donation initiative of COVID supplies to 53 African countries.   The Political Counselor of the Chinese Embassy in Malawi and the Malawi Minister of Health signed the handover certificate for the anti-epidemic materials on behalf of the two governments.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
First Lady of China donates anti-epidemic supplies to First Lady of Malawi

# Description
On July 28, 2020, a ceremony was held at the Kamuzu Presidential Palace for the donation of anti-epidemic materials to Malawi's First Lady, Monica Chakwera, on the behalf of China’s First Lady Peng Liyuan.  Chinese Ambassador to Malawi, Liu Hongyang, the First Lady of Malawi, and Malawi’s Minister of Health attended the ceremony and delivered speeches. The supplies, which included thermometers and face masks, are intended to help mothers, youths, and health workers.  The donation was made at the behest of the Organization of African First Ladies for Development and was part of a larger donation initiative of COVID supplies to 53 African countries.   The Political Counselor of the Chinese Embassy in Malawi and the Malawi Minister of Health signed the handover certificate for the anti-epidemic materials on behalf of the two governments.

title: First Lady of China donates anti-epidemic materials to First Lady of Mali on behalf of the Chinese Government for the fight against COVID-19
description: On July 28th, 2020, Zhu Liying, the Chinese Ambassador to Mali, and his wife handed over the donation of anti-epidemic materials on behalf of Peng Liyuan, the first lady of China, to Keïta Aminata Maïga, the first lady of Mali. Peng Liyuan's donation, in turn, was on behalf of the Chinese Government. The donated supplies included masks, thermometers, household appliances, and school supplies kits. The handover ceremony took place at Base B, Bamako, Mali.

title: China's First Lady donates COVID-19 relief supplies to Mauritania for the fight against Covid-19 on July 14, 2020
description: On July 14, 2020, the Chinese Embassy handed over China's First Lady, Peng Liyuan’s, donation of COVID-19 relief supplies to Mauritania’s First Lady. The donation included personal protective medical supplies for health personnel, thermometers and other equipment.This batch of supplies were targeted for women, children, and youth. The exact value of the donation is unknown.

title: Chinese government donates COVID medical materials to Mauritius
description: On July 23, 2020, Chinese Ambassador Sun Gongyi and his wife Wang Ju handed over anti-epidemic materials donated by the Chinese government to the wife of the Prime Minister of Mauritius, Kobita Jagannath, on behalf of first lady Peng Liyuan. The handover ceremony took place at the treasury building in Port-Louis, the capital of Mauritius.  The donated materials included medical protection gear, face masks, and body temperature scanning devices.   The supplies were donated at the request of the Organization of African First Ladies for Development. The donation to Mauritius was part of a larger series of donations to 53 African countries sent on the behalf of first lady Peng Liyuan.    The Mauritian Ministers of Social Integration, Social Security and National Solidarity, and Gender Equality and Family Welfare, as well as several female parliamentary representatives were also present at the handover ceremony.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese government donates COVID medical materials to Mauritius

# Description
On July 23, 2020, Chinese Ambassador Sun Gongyi and his wife Wang Ju handed over anti-epidemic materials donated by the Chinese government to the wife of the Prime Minister of Mauritius, Kobita Jagannath, on behalf of first lady Peng Liyuan. The handover ceremony took place at the treasury building in Port-Louis, the capital of Mauritius.  The donated materials included medical protection gear, face masks, and body temperature scanning devices.   The supplies were donated at the request of the Organization of African First Ladies for Development. The donation to Mauritius was part of a larger series of donations to 53 African countries sent on the behalf of first lady Peng Liyuan.    The Mauritian Ministers of Social Integration, Social Security and National Solidarity, and Gender Equality and Family Welfare, as well as several female parliamentary representatives were also present at the handover ceremony.

title: First Lady Peng Liyuan provides anti-epidemic supplies to l’Union des Femmes Marocaines in Morocco in July 2020
description: On July 21, 2020, the Chinese First Lady, Peng Liyuan, provided anti-epidemic supplies to the  l’Union des Femmes Marocaines in Morocco. These supplies will be used to improve COVID-19 response efforts in Morocco. The specific type, amount, and monetary value of this donation are unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Mao Jun, the Chargé d'affaires of the Chinese Embassy in Morocco, handed over the supplies on behalf of Peng Liyuan and the Chinese Government. Mrs. Fatima Dahbi and Mrs. Farida El Khamlichi, respectively vice-president and general secretary of the union, attended the ceremonny. After handing over the supplies, a handover certificate was jointly signed by China and Morocco.
combined_text:
# Sector

On July 21, 2020, the Chinese First Lady, Peng Liyuan, provided anti-epidemic supplies to the  l’Union des Femmes Marocaines in Morocco. These supplies will be used to improve COVID-19 response efforts in Morocco. The specific type, amount, and monetary value of this donation are unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Mao Jun, the Chargé d'affaires of the Chinese Embassy in Morocco, handed over the supplies on behalf of Peng Liyuan and the Chinese Government. Mrs. Fatima Dahbi and Mrs. Farida El Khamlichi, respectively vice-president and general secretary of the union, attended the ceremonny. After handing over the supplies, a handover certificate was jointly signed by China and Morocco.

title: Chinese First Lady donates 30 sewing machines to the Namibian first lady's One Economy Foundation (linked to Project ID#93215)
description: On July 10, 2020, the Chinese First Lady, Peng Liyuan, donated 30 sewing machines to Monica Geingob, First Lady of the Republic of Namibia, Monica Geingos' One Economy Foundation. The donation was made in support of women and children in Namibia. The Chinese Embassy in Namibia facilitated the donation, which was intended to support women's employment.   The donation was made alongside a donation of COVID-19 equipment from China's first lady (Project ID#93215).

title: First Lady of China donates medical supplies to First Lady of Rwanda for the fight against Covid-19 on July 7, 2020
description: On July 7, 2020, the Rwanda Biomedical Center (RBC) received 120,000 body temperature testers and 18,000 surgical face masks from the First Lady of China, Peng Liyuan. The supplies were a donation for the First Lady of Rwanda, Jeannette Kagame, and were delivered to Dr. Sabin Nsanzimana, the Director General of RBC. The First Lady of China donated the supplies to the Organization of African First Ladies, which then donated supplies to Rwanda.   The handover ceremony was held at the MPPC warehouse of Rwanda Biomedical Center (RBC) in Kigali. The Political Counselor of the Chinese Embassy in Rwanda, Xing Yuchun, the Advisor to the First Lady of Rwanda, Radegonde Ndejuru, and RBC’s Dr. Sabin Nsanzimana attended the ceremony.
staff_comments: Rwanda Biomedical Center (RBC) is also known as Centre Biomédical du Rwanda.AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

The Political Counselor of the Chinese Embassy in Rwanda, Xing Yuchun, the Advisor to the First Lady of Rwanda, Radegonde Ndejuru, and RBC’s Dr. Sabin Nsanzimana attended the ceremony.

title: Chinese government donates covid supplies to the Red Cross Society of Sao Tome and Principe in July 2020
description: On July 24, 2020, Wang Wei, Ambassador to Sao Tome and Principe, handed over to Lima, Director-General of the Red Cross Society of Sao Tome and Principe, the anti-epidemic materials donated to Sao Tome and Principe by Professor Peng Liyuan, wife of Chinese President Xi Jinping, on behalf of the Chinese government. The donation consisted of 10,000 masks and some infrared thermometers.

title: Chinese Government donates medical supplies to the Early Care Foundation in South Africa in August 2020
description: On August 28, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Pretoria, South Africa donated 18,000 medical masks and 120 forehead temperature guns to the Early Care Foundation. The foundation is a non-profit organization that provides early-childhood development support programs for home-based crèches in disadvantaged communities. Tshepo Motsepe, wife of South African President Cyril Ramaphosa, is described as a "patron" of the organization. The donation occurred on the urging of the First Lady of China, Peng Liyuan.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
